entry.def: Left is the past tense and past participle of leave .
If there is a certain amount of something left, or if you have a certain amount of it left, it remains when the rest has gone or been used.

example.ex: He's got plenty of money left...

entry.def: The left is one of two opposite directions, sides, or positions. If you are facing north and you turn to the left, you will be facing west. In the word 'to', the 't' is to the left of the 'o'.

example.ex: In Britain cars drive on the left.
...the brick wall to the left of the conservatory...

entry.def: Your left arm, leg, or ear, for example, is the one which is on the left side of your body. Your left shoe or glove is the one which is intended to be worn on your left foot or hand.
entry.tran: 左边的；左面的；左侧的；用在左边的

entry.def: You can refer to people who support the political ideals of socialism as the left. They are often contrasted with the right, who support the political ideals of capitalism and conservatism.

example.ex: The government's industrial policy has been fiercely attacked by the left.
example.tran: 政府的工业政策遭到了左派的猛烈抨击。

entry.def: If you say that a person or political party has moved to the left, you mean that their political beliefs have become more left-wing.

example.ex: After Mrs Thatcher's first election victory in 1979, Labour moved sharply to the left...
example.tran: 1979年撒切尔夫人首次大选获胜后，工党的路线明显左转。

example.ex: There will be a radical swing to the right or the left.
example.tran: 将出现极左或极右的情况。
